alert.note: Alert for Butler; Clarke; Conecuh; Monroe; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 18 at 12:12PM CDT until June 18 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Butler County in south central Alabama... Monroe County in south central Alabama... Northeastern Clarke County in southwestern Alabama... Wilcox County in south central Alabama... Central Conecuh County in south central Alabama... * Until 100 PM CDT. * At 1211 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles north of Yellow Bluff to 6 miles south of Whatley, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Monroeville, Evergreen, Camden, Frisco City, Peterman, Georgiana, Whatley, Pine Hill, Excel, Beatrice, Vredenburgh, Fulton, Repton, Yellow Bluff, Pine Apple and I65 And US 84. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
